resources.string: Iconic, 110-story skyscraper featuring expansive views of Chicago from its 103rd-story Skydeck.
Former Navy training center draws crowds with carnival rides, restaurants, shops & fireworks.
Small, free zoo with lions, primates, reptiles, a children\'s area & an interactive farm exhibit.
One of ten dedicated temples of the Bahá\'í Faith, it is the oldest surviving Bahá\'í House of Worship in the world.
Among the world’s largest, Grant Park’s 3-level rococo fountain (1927) offers light & water shows.

Discover a state-of-the-art collection of architecture, landscape design and art that provide the backdrop for hundreds of free cultural programs including concerts, exhibitions, tours, and family activities.
Over 40 Chicago landmarks on a 75-minute architecture boat tour along the three branches of the Chicago river covering how Chicago\'s buildings, architecture and engineering made the city famous.
